outputSpeech.ssml:
Here are the latest policies for Raya

Ended more than $60 billion in wasteful subsidies for big banks and used the savings to put the cost of college within reach for more families.

Want another policy topic?

card.content: New policiesEnded more than $60 billion in wasteful subsidies for big banks and used the savings to put the cost of college within reach for more families.
card.title: Categories in Raya

outputSpeech.text: With Washington Insider, you can ask the White House about political progress in America.  Just ask: What's up with economy?  The categories are economy, education, and healthcare.

sessionAttributes.1: Created and extended a tax credit worth $10,000 over four years that helps 9 million families cover the cost of college.
sessionAttributes.2: Expanded Pell Grants to reach an additional 3 million students and raised the current maximum award to $5,550, up from $4,730 in 2008.
sessionAttributes.3: Capped monthly student loan payments for responsible borrowers who make their payments on time so they aren't held back by debt as they start their careers.
sessionAttributes.4: Created a model financial aid disclosure form that makes the costs and responsibilities of student loans clear before students enroll in college.
sessionAttributes.5: Supported partnerships between community colleges and businesses to train workers with skills local employers need
sessionAttributes.6: Launched a College Scorecard to help students and families compare costs, the amount students borrow in loans, and graduation rates among schools and make informed decisions about which college to attend.
sessionAttributes.7: Rein in college cost by reforming student aid to colleges. Reward schools that set tuition prices responsibly. Schools that do the most to provide students with good long-term value should receive more money to help students attend than schools that don't.
sessionAttributes.8: Improve college quality and value through competition. Invest $1 billion in a competition to provide incentives for colleges to keep costs under control and graduate students on time.
sessionAttributes.9: Prepare workers with skills and credentials employers need. Support programs that train workers for jobs in growing industries like high-tech manufacturing and IT.
sessionAttributes.77: Ensure the wealthiest Americans do their fair share by paying at least the same tax rate as middle class families so we can reduce the deficit in a balanced way while preserving investments in education, clean energy, manufacturing, and small businesses.
